name: 吉塔
objective:
COURSE OUTLINE AND SYLLABUS
This course 'CLEAN ENERGY TECHNOLOGY' is a basic course taught entirely in English. The aim of this course is to provide introductory knowledge to students who have not studied Environmental Science as a subject. The clean strategies that can be used to prevent negative environmental impacts on the Earth will be discussed in this class. Students can gain introductory knowledge related to sustainable energy sources and innovative techniques to reduce harmful negative environmental impacts like Global Warming and Climate Change by sustainable use of resources. This course will also motivate students to improve their English language skills like conversing and discussing in English and will help them to deliver better English presentations. 
Week 1: Clean Energy Technology- Introduction and Basics
Week 2: Clean Energy sources
Week 3: Carbon Cycle and Footprint
Week 4: Carbon Trading
Week 5: Bio-geoengineering
Week 6: Carbon Sequestration
Week 7: Bioenergy production
Week 8: Carbon Farming
Week 9: Midterm Exam 
Week 10: Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
Week 11: Sustainable Biofuels
Week 12: Fuel cells
Week 13: Nuclear Energy
Week 14: Sustainable Agriculture
Week 15: Sustainable Conversion Technologies
Week 16: Green Architecture
Week 17: Ecotourism
Week 18: Final Exam
schedule:
1. The students of this class will be separated into groups for weekly presentation purposes and every week the Teacher will assign a topic for the presentation.
2. In every class, the Teacher will initially finish the power point presentation
3. Then one person from every group has to give his/her presentation.
scorePolicy:
1. The Teacher will conduct one Midterm exam and one Final exam throughout the semester
2. The questions for the exams will be from the power-point presentation of the Teacher. 
3. The total score of exam will be for 100 marks, in which the Teacher will consider the assignment marks, class attendance and the weekly presentation of every student.
4. In case of online classes, the teacher will ask all students to prepare assignments as midterm and final exams.
5. The assignment marks will be considered for exam grades along with class attendance and the weekly presentation of every student
materials:
1.　　The Teacher will not use any textbooks/bibliography materials for the class.
2.　　The students will have to study the Powerpoint presentations prepared and taught by the Teacher in every class.
